message.content:
{"id": "2345", 
"title": "Bug 2345 - Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)", 
"description": "Bug 2345 - When attempting to open a file with a different type of editor while the file is already open, the action has no effect. This issue was encountered during the reproduction of the steps in 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content. After selecting test.xml in the Navigator, choosing 'Open With... / Default Text Editor' does not open the file with the selected editor. Instead, it reactivates the scripted resource editor example. It is expected that a new editor should open on the file because the editor type is different.", 
"OB": "Reproduce the steps in 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content. Select test.xml in the Navigator, choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'. Nothing happens; it reactivates the scripted resource editor example. Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types. It should open a new editor on the file because the editor type is different. NOTES:", 
"EB": "Reproduce the steps in 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content. Select test.xml in the Navigator, choose 'Open With... / Default Text Editor'. Nothing happens; it reactivates the scripted resource editor example. Searching for an existing open file should also consider editor types. It is expected that a new editor should open on the file because the editor type is different. NOTES:", 
"SR": "The expected behavior is that when attempting to open a file with a different type of editor while the file is already open, a new editor window should open for the file with the selected editor."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '2345', 'title': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ)', 'description': 'Bug 2345[Editor Mgmt] Open with a different type of editor has no effect if file already open (1GEWMSQ) ', 'OB': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: ", 'EB': "Reproduce the steps in: 1GEWMOZ: ITPUI:WIN2000Scripted resource editor example opens on XML files by default new basic project new file test.xml the editor used is the scripted resource editor example, which totally ignores the XML file content select test.xml in Navigator choose Open With... / Default Text Editor nothing happens; it's reactivating the scripted resource editor exampleSearching for an existing open file should also consider editor types.It should open a new editor on the file, because the editor type is different.NOTES: ", 'SR': ''}
